class LazyBoostingClassifier(sklearn.base.ClassifierMixin): 
 87class LazyBoostingClassifier(ClassifierMixin):
 88    """
 89
 90    Fitting -- almost -- all the classification algorithms
 91    and returning their scores.
 92
 93    Parameters:
 94
 95        verbose: int, optional (default=0)
 96            Any positive number for verbosity.
 97
 98        ignore_warnings: bool, optional (default=True)
 99            When set to True, the warning related to algorigms that are not
100            able to run are ignored.
101
102        custom_metric: function, optional (default=None)
103            When function is provided, models are evaluated based on the custom
104              evaluation metric provided.
105
106        predictions: bool, optional (default=False)
107            When set to True, the predictions of all the models models are
108            returned as data frame.
109
110        sort_by: string, optional (default='Accuracy')
111            Sort models by a metric. Available options are 'Accuracy',
112            'Balanced Accuracy', 'ROC AUC', 'F1 Score' or a custom metric
113            identified by its name and provided by custom_metric.
114
115        random_state: int, optional (default=42)
116            Reproducibiility seed.
117
118        estimators: list, optional (default='all')
119            list of Estimators names or just 'all' for > 90 classifiers
120            (default='all')
121
122        preprocess: bool, preprocessing is done when set to True
123
124        n_jobs: int, when possible, run in parallel
125            For now, only used by individual models that support it.
126
127        n_layers: int, optional (default=3)
128            Number of layers of GenericBoostingClassifiers to be used.
129
130        All the other parameters are the same as GenericBoostingClassifier's.
131
132    Attributes:
133
134        models_: dict-object
135            Returns a dictionary with each model pipeline as value
136            with key as name of models.
137
138        best_model_: object
139            Returns the best model pipeline.
140
141    Examples
142
143        ```python
144        import os
145        import mlsauce as ms
146        from sklearn.datasets import load_breast_cancer, load_iris, load_wine, load_digits
147        from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
148        from time import time
149
150        load_models = [load_breast_cancer, load_iris, load_wine]
151
152        for model in load_models:
153
154            data = model()
155            X = data.data
156            y= data.target
157
158            X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size = .2, random_state = 13)
159
160            clf = ms.LazyBoostingClassifier(verbose=1, ignore_warnings=False,
161                                            custom_metric=None, preprocess=False)
162
163            start = time()
164            models, predictioms = clf.fit(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)
165            print(f"\nElapsed: {time() - start} seconds\n")
166
167            print(models)
168        ```
169
170    """
171
172    def __init__(
173        self,
174        verbose=0,
175        ignore_warnings=True,
176        custom_metric=None,
177        predictions=False,
178        sort_by="Accuracy",
179        random_state=42,
180        estimators="all",
181        preprocess=False,
182        n_jobs=None,
183    ):
184        self.verbose = verbose
185        self.ignore_warnings = ignore_warnings
186        self.custom_metric = custom_metric
187        self.predictions = predictions
188        self.sort_by = sort_by
189        self.models_ = {}
190        self.best_model_ = None
191        self.random_state = random_state
192        self.estimators = estimators
193        self.preprocess = preprocess
194        self.n_jobs = n_jobs
195
196    def fit(self, X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, **kwargs):
197        """Fit classifiers to X_train and y_train, predict and score on X_test,
198        y_test.
199
200        Parameters:
201
202            X_train: array-like,
203                Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
204                and columns is the number of features.
205
206            X_test: array-like,
207                Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
208                and columns is the number of features.
209
210            y_train: array-like,
211                Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
212                and columns is the number of features.
213
214            y_test: array-like,
215                Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
216                and columns is the number of features.
217
218            **kwargs: dict,
219                Additional arguments to be passed to the fit GenericBoostingClassifier.
220
221        Returns:
222
223            scores: Pandas DataFrame
224                Returns metrics of all the models in a Pandas DataFrame.
225
226            predictions: Pandas DataFrame
227                Returns predictions of all the models in a Pandas DataFrame.
228        """
229        Accuracy = []
230        B_Accuracy = []
231        ROC_AUC = []
232        F1 = []
233        names = []
234        TIME = []
235        predictions = {}
236
237        if self.custom_metric is not None:
238            CUSTOM_METRIC = []
239
240        if isinstance(X_train, np.ndarray):
241            X_train = pd.DataFrame(X_train)
242            X_test = pd.DataFrame(X_test)
243
244        numeric_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
245        categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=["object"]).columns
246
247        categorical_low, categorical_high = get_card_split(
248            X_train, categorical_features
249        )
250
251        if self.preprocess is True:
252            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
253                transformers=[
254                    ("numeric", numeric_transformer, numeric_features),
255                    (
256                        "categorical_low",
257                        categorical_transformer_low,
258                        categorical_low,
259                    ),
260                    (
261                        "categorical_high",
262                        categorical_transformer_high,
263                        categorical_high,
264                    ),
265                ]
266            )
267
268        # baseline models
269        try:
270            baseline_names = ["RandomForestClassifier", "XGBClassifier"]
271            baseline_models = [RandomForestClassifier(), xgb.XGBClassifier()]
272        except Exception as exception:
273            baseline_names = ["RandomForestClassifier"]
274            baseline_models = [RandomForestClassifier()]
275
276        if self.verbose > 0:
277            print("\n Fitting baseline models...")
278        for name, model in tqdm(zip(baseline_names, baseline_models)):
279            start = time.time()
280            try:
281                model.fit(X_train, y_train)
282                self.models_[name] = model
283                y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
284                accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred, normalize=True)
285                b_accuracy = balanced_accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
286                f1 = f1_score(y_test, y_pred, average="weighted")
287                try:
288                    roc_auc = roc_auc_score(y_test, y_pred)
289                except Exception as exception:
290                    roc_auc = None
291                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
292                        print("ROC AUC couldn't be calculated for " + name)
293                        print(exception)
294                names.append(name)
295                Accuracy.append(accuracy)
296                B_Accuracy.append(b_accuracy)
297                ROC_AUC.append(roc_auc)
298                F1.append(f1)
299                TIME.append(time.time() - start)
300                if self.custom_metric is not None:
301                    custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
302                    CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
303                if self.verbose > 0:
304                    if self.custom_metric is not None:
305                        print(
306                            {
307                                "Model": name,
308                                "Accuracy": accuracy,
309                                "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
310                                "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
311                                "F1 Score": f1,
312                                self.custom_metric.__name__: custom_metric,
313                                "Time taken": time.time() - start,
314                            }
315                        )
316                    else:
317                        print(
318                            {
319                                "Model": name,
320                                "Accuracy": accuracy,
321                                "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
322                                "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
323                                "F1 Score": f1,
324                                "Time taken": time.time() - start,
325                            }
326                        )
327                if self.predictions:
328                    predictions[name] = y_pred
329            except Exception as exception:
330                if self.ignore_warnings is False:
331                    print(name + " model failed to execute")
332                    print(exception)
333
334        if self.estimators == "all":
335            self.classifiers = REGRESSORS
336        else:
337            self.classifiers = [
338                ("GBoostClassifier(" + est[0] + ")", est[1]())
339                for est in all_estimators()
340                if (
341                    issubclass(est[1], RegressorMixin)
342                    and (est[0] in self.estimators)
343                )
344            ]
345
346        if self.preprocess is True:
347
348            for name, model in tqdm(self.classifiers):  # do parallel exec
349
350                other_args = (
351                    {}
352                )  # use this trick for `random_state` too --> refactor
353                try:
354                    if (
355                        "n_jobs" in model().get_params().keys()
356                        and name.find("LogisticRegression") == -1
357                    ):
358                        other_args["n_jobs"] = self.n_jobs
359                except Exception:
360                    pass
361
362                start = time.time()
363
364                try:
365                    if "random_state" in model().get_params().keys():
366                        fitted_clf = GenericBoostingClassifier(
367                            {**other_args, **kwargs},
368                            verbose=self.verbose,
369                            obj=model(random_state=self.random_state),
370                        )
371
372                    else:
373                        fitted_clf = GenericBoostingClassifier(
374                            obj=model(**kwargs),
375                            verbose=self.verbose,
376                        )
377
378                    if self.verbose > 0:
379                        print("\n Fitting boosted " + name + " model...")
380                    fitted_clf.fit(X_train, y_train)
381
382                    pipe = Pipeline(
383                        [
384                            ("preprocessor", preprocessor),
385                            ("classifier", fitted_clf),
386                        ]
387                    )
388
389                    if self.verbose > 0:
390                        print("\n Fitting boosted " + name + " model...")
391                    pipe.fit(X_train, y_train)
392                    self.models_[name] = pipe
393                    y_pred = pipe.predict(X_test)
394                    accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred, normalize=True)
395                    b_accuracy = balanced_accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
396                    f1 = f1_score(y_test, y_pred, average="weighted")
397                    try:
398                        roc_auc = roc_auc_score(y_test, y_pred)
399                    except Exception as exception:
400                        roc_auc = None
401                        if self.ignore_warnings is False:
402                            print("ROC AUC couldn't be calculated for " + name)
403                            print(exception)
404                    names.append(name)
405                    Accuracy.append(accuracy)
406                    B_Accuracy.append(b_accuracy)
407                    ROC_AUC.append(roc_auc)
408                    F1.append(f1)
409                    TIME.append(time.time() - start)
410                    if self.custom_metric is not None:
411                        custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
412                        CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
413                    if self.verbose > 0:
414                        if self.custom_metric is not None:
415                            print(
416                                {
417                                    "Model": name,
418                                    "Accuracy": accuracy,
419                                    "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
420                                    "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
421                                    "F1 Score": f1,
422                                    self.custom_metric.__name__: custom_metric,
423                                    "Time taken": time.time() - start,
424                                }
425                            )
426                        else:
427                            print(
428                                {
429                                    "Model": name,
430                                    "Accuracy": accuracy,
431                                    "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
432                                    "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
433                                    "F1 Score": f1,
434                                    "Time taken": time.time() - start,
435                                }
436                            )
437                    if self.predictions:
438                        predictions[name] = y_pred
439                except Exception as exception:
440                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
441                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
442                        print(exception)
443
444        else:  # no preprocessing
445
446            for name, model in tqdm(self.classifiers):  # do parallel exec
447                start = time.time()
448                try:
449                    if "random_state" in model().get_params().keys():
450                        fitted_clf = GenericBoostingClassifier(
451                            obj=model(random_state=self.random_state),
452                            verbose=self.verbose,
453                            **kwargs
454                        )
455
456                    else:
457                        fitted_clf = GenericBoostingClassifier(
458                            obj=model(), verbose=self.verbose, **kwargs
459                        )
460
461                    fitted_clf.fit(X_train, y_train)
462
463                    self.models_[name] = fitted_clf
464                    y_pred = fitted_clf.predict(X_test)
465                    accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred, normalize=True)
466                    b_accuracy = balanced_accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
467                    f1 = f1_score(y_test, y_pred, average="weighted")
468                    try:
469                        roc_auc = roc_auc_score(y_test, y_pred)
470                    except Exception as exception:
471                        roc_auc = None
472                        if self.ignore_warnings is False:
473                            print("ROC AUC couldn't be calculated for " + name)
474                            print(exception)
475                    names.append(name)
476                    Accuracy.append(accuracy)
477                    B_Accuracy.append(b_accuracy)
478                    ROC_AUC.append(roc_auc)
479                    F1.append(f1)
480                    TIME.append(time.time() - start)
481                    if self.custom_metric is not None:
482                        custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
483                        CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
484                    if self.verbose > 0:
485                        if self.custom_metric is not None:
486                            print(
487                                {
488                                    "Model": name,
489                                    "Accuracy": accuracy,
490                                    "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
491                                    "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
492                                    "F1 Score": f1,
493                                    self.custom_metric.__name__: custom_metric,
494                                    "Time taken": time.time() - start,
495                                }
496                            )
497                        else:
498                            print(
499                                {
500                                    "Model": name,
501                                    "Accuracy": accuracy,
502                                    "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
503                                    "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
504                                    "F1 Score": f1,
505                                    "Time taken": time.time() - start,
506                                }
507                            )
508                    if self.predictions:
509                        predictions[name] = y_pred
510                except Exception as exception:
511                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
512                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
513                        print(exception)
514
515        if self.custom_metric is None:
516            scores = pd.DataFrame(
517                {
518                    "Model": names,
519                    "Accuracy": Accuracy,
520                    "Balanced Accuracy": B_Accuracy,
521                    "ROC AUC": ROC_AUC,
522                    "F1 Score": F1,
523                    "Time Taken": TIME,
524                }
525            )
526        else:
527            scores = pd.DataFrame(
528                {
529                    "Model": names,
530                    "Accuracy": Accuracy,
531                    "Balanced Accuracy": B_Accuracy,
532                    "ROC AUC": ROC_AUC,
533                    "F1 Score": F1,
534                    "Custom metric": CUSTOM_METRIC,
535                    "Time Taken": TIME,
536                }
537            )
538        scores = scores.sort_values(by=self.sort_by, ascending=False).set_index(
539            "Model"
540        )
541
542        self.best_model_ = self.models_[scores.index[0]]
543
544        if self.predictions:
545            predictions_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(predictions)
546        return scores, predictions_df if self.predictions is True else scores
547
548    def get_best_model(self):
549        """
550        This function returns the best model pipeline based on the sort_by metric.
551
552        Returns:
553
554            best_model: object,
555                Returns the best model pipeline based on the sort_by metric.
556
557        """
558        return self.best_model_
559
560    def provide_models(self, X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test):
561        """Returns all the model objects trained. If fit hasn't been called yet,
562        then it's called to return the models.
563
564        Parameters:
565
566        X_train: array-like,
567            Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
568            and columns is the number of features.
569
570        X_test: array-like,
571            Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
572            and columns is the number of features.
573
574        y_train: array-like,
575            Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
576            and columns is the number of features.
577
578        y_test: array-like,
579            Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
580            and columns is the number of features.
581
582        Returns:
583
584            models: dict-object,
585                Returns a dictionary with each model's pipeline as value
586                and key = name of the model.
587        """
588        if len(self.models_.keys()) == 0:
589            self.fit(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)
590
591        return self.models_

Fitting -- almost -- all the classification algorithms and returning their scores.

Parameters:

    verbose: int, optional (default=0)
        Any positive number for verbosity.

    ignore_warnings: bool, optional (default=True)
        When set to True, the warning related to algorigms that are not
        able to run are ignored.

    custom_metric: function, optional (default=None)
        When function is provided, models are evaluated based on the custom
          evaluation metric provided.

    predictions: bool, optional (default=False)
        When set to True, the predictions of all the models models are
        returned as data frame.

    sort_by: string, optional (default='Accuracy')
        Sort models by a metric. Available options are 'Accuracy',
        'Balanced Accuracy', 'ROC AUC', 'F1 Score' or a custom metric
        identified by its name and provided by custom_metric.

    random_state: int, optional (default=42)
        Reproducibiility seed.

    estimators: list, optional (default='all')
        list of Estimators names or just 'all' for > 90 classifiers
        (default='all')

    preprocess: bool, preprocessing is done when set to True

    n_jobs: int, when possible, run in parallel
        For now, only used by individual models that support it.

    n_layers: int, optional (default=3)
        Number of layers of GenericBoostingClassifiers to be used.

    All the other parameters are the same as GenericBoostingClassifier's.

Attributes:

    models_: dict-object
        Returns a dictionary with each model pipeline as value
        with key as name of models.

    best_model_: object
        Returns the best model pipeline.

Examples


    


        import os
        import mlsauce as ms
        from sklearn.datasets import load_breast_cancer, load_iris, load_wine, load_digits
        from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
        from time import time

        load_models = [load_breast_cancer, load_iris, load_wine]

        for model in load_models:

            data = model()
            X = data.data
            y= data.target

            X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size = .2, random_state = 13)

            clf = ms.LazyBoostingClassifier(verbose=1, ignore_warnings=False,
                                            custom_metric=None, preprocess=False)

            start = time()
            models, predictioms = clf.fit(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)
            print(f"
Elapsed: {time() - start} seconds
")

            print(models)

439                except Exception as exception:
440                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
441                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
442                        print(exception)
443
444        else:  # no preprocessing
445
446            for name, model in tqdm(self.classifiers):  # do parallel exec
447                start = time.time()
448                try:
449                    if "random_state" in model().get_params().keys():
450                        fitted_clf = GenericBoostingClassifier(
451                            obj=model(random_state=self.random_state),
452                            verbose=self.verbose,
453                            **kwargs
454                        )
455
456                    else:
457                        fitted_clf = GenericBoostingClassifier(
458                            obj=model(), verbose=self.verbose, **kwargs
459                        )
460
461                    fitted_clf.fit(X_train, y_train)
462
463                    self.models_[name] = fitted_clf
464                    y_pred = fitted_clf.predict(X_test)
465                    accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred, normalize=True)
466                    b_accuracy = balanced_accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
467                    f1 = f1_score(y_test, y_pred, average="weighted")
468                    try:
469                        roc_auc = roc_auc_score(y_test, y_pred)
470                    except Exception as exception:
471                        roc_auc = None
472                        if self.ignore_warnings is False:
473                            print("ROC AUC couldn't be calculated for " + name)
474                            print(exception)
475                    names.append(name)
476                    Accuracy.append(accuracy)
477                    B_Accuracy.append(b_accuracy)
478                    ROC_AUC.append(roc_auc)
479                    F1.append(f1)
480                    TIME.append(time.time() - start)
481                    if self.custom_metric is not None:
482                        custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
483                        CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
484                    if self.verbose > 0:
485                        if self.custom_metric is not None:
486                            print(
487                                {
488                                    "Model": name,
489                                    "Accuracy": accuracy,
490                                    "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
491                                    "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
492                                    "F1 Score": f1,
493                                    self.custom_metric.__name__: custom_metric,
494                                    "Time taken": time.time() - start,
495                                }
496                            )
497                        else:
498                            print(
499                                {
500                                    "Model": name,
501                                    "Accuracy": accuracy,
502                                    "Balanced Accuracy": b_accuracy,
503                                    "ROC AUC": roc_auc,
504                                    "F1 Score": f1,
505                                    "Time taken": time.time() - start,
506                                }
507                            )
508                    if self.predictions:
509                        predictions[name] = y_pred
510                except Exception as exception:
511                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
512                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
513                        print(exception)
514
515        if self.custom_metric is None:
516            scores = pd.DataFrame(
517                {
518                    "Model": names,
519                    "Accuracy": Accuracy,
520                    "Balanced Accuracy": B_Accuracy,
521                    "ROC AUC": ROC_AUC,
522                    "F1 Score": F1,
523                    "Time Taken": TIME,
524                }
525            )
526        else:
527            scores = pd.DataFrame(
528                {
529                    "Model": names,
530                    "Accuracy": Accuracy,
531                    "Balanced Accuracy": B_Accuracy,
532                    "ROC AUC": ROC_AUC,
533                    "F1 Score": F1,
534                    "Custom metric": CUSTOM_METRIC,
535                    "Time Taken": TIME,
536                }
537            )
538        scores = scores.sort_values(by=self.sort_by, ascending=False).set_index(
539            "Model"
540        )
541
542        self.best_model_ = self.models_[scores.index[0]]
543
544        if self.predictions:
545            predictions_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(predictions)
546        return scores, predictions_df if self.predictions is True else scores

class LazyBoostingRegressor(sklearn.base.RegressorMixin): 
 91class LazyBoostingRegressor(RegressorMixin):
 92    """
 93        Fitting -- almost -- all the regression algorithms
 94        and returning their scores.
 95
 96    Parameters:
 97
 98        verbose: int, optional (default=0)
 99            Any positive number for verbosity.
100
101        ignore_warnings: bool, optional (default=True)
102            When set to True, the warning related to algorigms that are not able to run are ignored.
103
104        custom_metric: function, optional (default=None)
105            When function is provided, models are evaluated based on the custom evaluation metric provided.
106
107        predictions: bool, optional (default=False)
108            When set to True, the predictions of all the models models are returned as dataframe.
109
110        sort_by: string, optional (default='RMSE')
111            Sort models by a metric. Available options are 'R-Squared', 'Adjusted R-Squared', 'RMSE', 'Time Taken' and 'Custom Metric'.
112            or a custom metric identified by its name and provided by custom_metric.
113
114        random_state: int, optional (default=42)
115            Reproducibiility seed.
116
117        estimators: list, optional (default='all')
118            list of Estimators names or just 'all' (default='all')
119
120        preprocess: bool
121            preprocessing is done when set to True
122
123        n_jobs : int, when possible, run in parallel
124            For now, only used by individual models that support it.
125
126        n_layers: int, optional (default=3)
127            Number of layers of CustomRegressors to be used.
128
129        All the other parameters are the same as CustomRegressor's.
130
131    Attributes:
132
133        models_: dict-object
134            Returns a dictionary with each model pipeline as value
135            with key as name of models.
136
137        best_model_: object
138            Returns the best model pipeline based on the sort_by metric.
139
140    Examples:
141
142        ```python
143        import os
144        import mlsauce as ms
145        from sklearn.datasets import load_diabetes
146        from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
147
148        data = load_diabetes()
149        X = data.data
150        y= data.target
151        X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size = .2, random_state = 123)
152
153        regr = ms.LazyBoostingRegressor(verbose=0, ignore_warnings=True,
154                                        custom_metric=None, preprocess=True)
155        models, predictioms = regr.fit(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)
156        model_dictionary = regr.provide_models(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)
157        print(models)
158        ```
159
160    """
161
162    def __init__(
163        self,
164        verbose=0,
165        ignore_warnings=True,
166        custom_metric=None,
167        predictions=False,
168        sort_by="RMSE",
169        random_state=42,
170        estimators="all",
171        preprocess=False,
172        n_jobs=None,
173    ):
174        self.verbose = verbose
175        self.ignore_warnings = ignore_warnings
176        self.custom_metric = custom_metric
177        self.predictions = predictions
178        self.sort_by = sort_by
179        self.models_ = {}
180        self.best_model_ = None
181        self.random_state = random_state
182        self.estimators = estimators
183        self.preprocess = preprocess
184        self.n_jobs = n_jobs
185
186    def fit(self, X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test, **kwargs):
187        """Fit Regression algorithms to X_train and y_train, predict and score on X_test, y_test.
188
189        Parameters:
190
191            X_train : array-like,
192                Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
193                and columns is the number of features.
194
195            X_test : array-like,
196                Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
197                and columns is the number of features.
198
199            y_train : array-like,
200                Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
201                and columns is the number of features.
202
203            y_test : array-like,
204                Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
205                and columns is the number of features.
206
207            **kwargs: dict,
208                Additional parameters to be passed to the GenericBoostingRegressor.
209
210        Returns:
211        -------
212        scores:  Pandas DataFrame
213            Returns metrics of all the models in a Pandas DataFrame.
214
215        predictions : Pandas DataFrame
216            Returns predictions of all the models in a Pandas DataFrame.
217
218        """
219        R2 = []
220        ADJR2 = []
221        RMSE = []
222        # WIN = []
223        names = []
224        TIME = []
225        predictions = {}
226
227        if self.custom_metric:
228            CUSTOM_METRIC = []
229
230        if isinstance(X_train, np.ndarray):
231            X_train = pd.DataFrame(X_train)
232            X_test = pd.DataFrame(X_test)
233
234        numeric_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
235        categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=["object"]).columns
236
237        categorical_low, categorical_high = get_card_split(
238            X_train, categorical_features
239        )
240
241        if self.preprocess is True:
242            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
243                transformers=[
244                    ("numeric", numeric_transformer, numeric_features),
245                    (
246                        "categorical_low",
247                        categorical_transformer_low,
248                        categorical_low,
249                    ),
250                    (
251                        "categorical_high",
252                        categorical_transformer_high,
253                        categorical_high,
254                    ),
255                ]
256            )
257
258        # base models
259        try:
260            baseline_names = [
261                "RandomForestRegressor",
262                "XGBRegressor",
263                "GradientBoostingRegressor",
264            ]
265            baseline_models = [
266                RandomForestRegressor(),
267                xgb.XGBRegressor(),
268                GradientBoostingRegressor(),
269            ]
270        except Exception as exception:
271            baseline_names = [
272                "RandomForestRegressor",
273                "GradientBoostingRegressor",
274            ]
275            baseline_models = [
276                RandomForestRegressor(),
277                GradientBoostingRegressor(),
278            ]
279
280        if self.verbose > 0:
281            print("\n Fitting baseline models...")
282        for name, model in tqdm(zip(baseline_names, baseline_models)):
283            start = time.time()
284            try:
285                model.fit(X_train, y_train)
286                self.models_[name] = model
287                y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
288                r_squared = r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
289                adj_rsquared = adjusted_rsquared(
290                    r_squared, X_test.shape[0], X_test.shape[1]
291                )
292                rmse = mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred, squared=False)
293
294                names.append(name)
295                R2.append(r_squared)
296                ADJR2.append(adj_rsquared)
297                RMSE.append(rmse)
298                TIME.append(time.time() - start)
299
300                if self.custom_metric:
301                    custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
302                    CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
303
304                if self.verbose > 0:
305                    scores_verbose = {
306                        "Model": name,
307                        "R-Squared": r_squared,
308                        "Adjusted R-Squared": adj_rsquared,
309                        "RMSE": rmse,
310                        "Time taken": time.time() - start,
311                    }
312
313                    if self.custom_metric:
314                        scores_verbose["Custom metric"] = custom_metric
315
316                    print(scores_verbose)
317                if self.predictions:
318                    predictions[name] = y_pred
319            except Exception as exception:
320                if self.ignore_warnings is False:
321                    print(name + " model failed to execute")
322                    print(exception)
323
324        if self.estimators == "all":
325            self.regressors = REGRESSORS
326        else:
327            self.regressors = [
328                ("GenericBooster(" + est[0] + ")", est[1](**kwargs))
329                for est in all_estimators()
330                if (
331                    issubclass(est[1], RegressorMixin)
332                    and (est[0] in self.estimators)
333                )
334            ]
335
336        if self.preprocess is True:
337
338            for name, regr in tqdm(self.regressors):  # do parallel exec
339
340                start = time.time()
341
342                try:
343
344                    model = GenericBoostingRegressor(
345                        obj=regr(), verbose=self.verbose, **kwargs
346                    )
347
348                    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
349
350                    pipe = Pipeline(
351                        steps=[
352                            ("preprocessor", preprocessor),
353                            ("regressor", model),
354                        ]
355                    )
356                    if self.verbose > 0:
357                        print("\n Fitting boosted " + name + " model...")
358                    pipe.fit(X_train, y_train)
359
360                    self.models_[name] = pipe
361                    y_pred = pipe.predict(X_test)
362                    r_squared = r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
363                    adj_rsquared = adjusted_rsquared(
364                        r_squared, X_test.shape[0], X_test.shape[1]
365                    )
366                    rmse = mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred, squared=False)
367
368                    names.append(name)
369                    R2.append(r_squared)
370                    ADJR2.append(adj_rsquared)
371                    RMSE.append(rmse)
372                    TIME.append(time.time() - start)
373
374                    if self.custom_metric:
375                        custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
376                        CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
377
378                    if self.verbose > 0:
379                        scores_verbose = {
380                            "Model": name,
381                            "R-Squared": r_squared,
382                            "Adjusted R-Squared": adj_rsquared,
383                            "RMSE": rmse,
384                            "Time taken": time.time() - start,
385                        }
386
387                        if self.custom_metric:
388                            scores_verbose["Custom metric"] = custom_metric
389
390                        print(scores_verbose)
391                    if self.predictions:
392                        predictions[name] = y_pred
393
394                except Exception as exception:
395
396                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
397                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
398                        print(exception)
399
400        else:  # self.preprocess is False; no preprocessing
401
402            for name, regr in tqdm(self.regressors):  # do parallel exec
403                start = time.time()
404                try:
405
406                    model = GenericBoostingRegressor(
407                        obj=regr(), verbose=self.verbose, **kwargs
408                    )
409
410                    if self.verbose > 0:
411                        print("\n Fitting boosted " + name + " model...")
412                    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
413
414                    self.models_[name] = model
415                    y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
416
417                    r_squared = r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
418                    adj_rsquared = adjusted_rsquared(
419                        r_squared, X_test.shape[0], X_test.shape[1]
420                    )
421                    rmse = mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred, squared=False)
422
423                    names.append(name)
424                    R2.append(r_squared)
425                    ADJR2.append(adj_rsquared)
426                    RMSE.append(rmse)
427                    TIME.append(time.time() - start)
428
429                    if self.custom_metric:
430                        custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
431                        CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
432
433                    if self.verbose > 0:
434                        scores_verbose = {
435                            "Model": name,
436                            "R-Squared": r_squared,
437                            "Adjusted R-Squared": adj_rsquared,
438                            "RMSE": rmse,
439                            "Time taken": time.time() - start,
440                        }
441
442                        if self.custom_metric:
443                            scores_verbose["Custom metric"] = custom_metric
444
445                        print(scores_verbose)
446                    if self.predictions:
447                        predictions[name] = y_pred
448                except Exception as exception:
449                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
450                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
451                        print(exception)
452
453        scores = {
454            "Model": names,
455            "Adjusted R-Squared": ADJR2,
456            "R-Squared": R2,
457            "RMSE": RMSE,
458            "Time Taken": TIME,
459        }
460
461        if self.custom_metric:
462            scores["Custom metric"] = CUSTOM_METRIC
463
464        scores = pd.DataFrame(scores)
465        scores = scores.sort_values(by=self.sort_by, ascending=True).set_index(
466            "Model"
467        )
468
469        self.best_model_ = self.models_[scores.index[0]]
470
471        if self.predictions:
472            predictions_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(predictions)
473        return scores, predictions_df if self.predictions is True else scores
474
475    def get_best_model(self):
476        """
477        This function returns the best model pipeline based on the sort_by metric.
478
479        Returns:
480
481            best_model: object,
482                Returns the best model pipeline based on the sort_by metric.
483
484        """
485        return self.best_model_
486
487    def provide_models(self, X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test):
488        """
489        This function returns all the model objects trained in fit function.
490        If fit is not called already, then we call fit and then return the models.
491
492        Parameters:
493
494            X_train : array-like,
495                Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
496                and columns is the number of features.
497
498            X_test : array-like,
499                Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
500                and columns is the number of features.
501
502            y_train : array-like,
503                Training vectors, where rows is the number of samples
504                and columns is the number of features.
505
506            y_test : array-like,
507                Testing vectors, where rows is the number of samples
508                and columns is the number of features.
509
510        Returns:
511
512            models: dict-object,
513                Returns a dictionary with each model pipeline as value
514                with key as name of models.
515
516        """
517        if len(self.models_.keys()) == 0:
518            self.fit(X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test)
519
520        return self.models_

270        except Exception as exception:
271            baseline_names = [
272                "RandomForestRegressor",
273                "GradientBoostingRegressor",
274            ]
275            baseline_models = [
276                RandomForestRegressor(),
277                GradientBoostingRegressor(),
278            ]
279
280        if self.verbose > 0:
281            print("\n Fitting baseline models...")
282        for name, model in tqdm(zip(baseline_names, baseline_models)):
283            start = time.time()
284            try:
285                model.fit(X_train, y_train)
286                self.models_[name] = model
287                y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
288                r_squared = r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
289                adj_rsquared = adjusted_rsquared(
290                    r_squared, X_test.shape[0], X_test.shape[1]
291                )
292                rmse = mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred, squared=False)
293
294                names.append(name)
295                R2.append(r_squared)
296                ADJR2.append(adj_rsquared)
297                RMSE.append(rmse)
298                TIME.append(time.time() - start)
299
300                if self.custom_metric:
301                    custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
302                    CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
303
304                if self.verbose > 0:
305                    scores_verbose = {
306                        "Model": name,
307                        "R-Squared": r_squared,
308                        "Adjusted R-Squared": adj_rsquared,
309                        "RMSE": rmse,
310                        "Time taken": time.time() - start,
311                    }
312
313                    if self.custom_metric:
314                        scores_verbose["Custom metric"] = custom_metric
315
316                    print(scores_verbose)
317                if self.predictions:
318                    predictions[name] = y_pred
319            except Exception as exception:
320                if self.ignore_warnings is False:
321                    print(name + " model failed to execute")
322                    print(exception)
323
324        if self.estimators == "all":
325            self.regressors = REGRESSORS
326        else:
327            self.regressors = [
328                ("GenericBooster(" + est[0] + ")", est[1](**kwargs))
329                for est in all_estimators()
330                if (
331                    issubclass(est[1], RegressorMixin)
332                    and (est[0] in self.estimators)
333                )
334            ]
335
336        if self.preprocess is True:
337
338            for name, regr in tqdm(self.regressors):  # do parallel exec
339
340                start = time.time()
341
342                try:
343
344                    model = GenericBoostingRegressor(
345                        obj=regr(), verbose=self.verbose, **kwargs
346                    )
347
348                    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
349
350                    pipe = Pipeline(
351                        steps=[
352                            ("preprocessor", preprocessor),
353                            ("regressor", model),
354                        ]
355                    )
356                    if self.verbose > 0:
357                        print("\n Fitting boosted " + name + " model...")
358                    pipe.fit(X_train, y_train)
359
360                    self.models_[name] = pipe
361                    y_pred = pipe.predict(X_test)
362                    r_squared = r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
363                    adj_rsquared = adjusted_rsquared(
364                        r_squared, X_test.shape[0], X_test.shape[1]
365                    )
366                    rmse = mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred, squared=False)
367
368                    names.append(name)
369                    R2.append(r_squared)
370                    ADJR2.append(adj_rsquared)
371                    RMSE.append(rmse)
372                    TIME.append(time.time() - start)
373
374                    if self.custom_metric:
375                        custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
376                        CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
377
378                    if self.verbose > 0:
379                        scores_verbose = {
380                            "Model": name,
381                            "R-Squared": r_squared,
382                            "Adjusted R-Squared": adj_rsquared,
383                            "RMSE": rmse,
384                            "Time taken": time.time() - start,
385                        }
386
387                        if self.custom_metric:
388                            scores_verbose["Custom metric"] = custom_metric
389
390                        print(scores_verbose)
391                    if self.predictions:
392                        predictions[name] = y_pred
393
394                except Exception as exception:
395
396                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
397                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
398                        print(exception)
399
400        else:  # self.preprocess is False; no preprocessing
401
402            for name, regr in tqdm(self.regressors):  # do parallel exec
403                start = time.time()
404                try:
405
406                    model = GenericBoostingRegressor(
407                        obj=regr(), verbose=self.verbose, **kwargs
408                    )
409
410                    if self.verbose > 0:
411                        print("\n Fitting boosted " + name + " model...")
412                    model.fit(X_train, y_train)
413
414                    self.models_[name] = model
415                    y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
416
417                    r_squared = r2_score(y_test, y_pred)
418                    adj_rsquared = adjusted_rsquared(
419                        r_squared, X_test.shape[0], X_test.shape[1]
420                    )
421                    rmse = mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred, squared=False)
422
423                    names.append(name)
424                    R2.append(r_squared)
425                    ADJR2.append(adj_rsquared)
426                    RMSE.append(rmse)
427                    TIME.append(time.time() - start)
428
429                    if self.custom_metric:
430                        custom_metric = self.custom_metric(y_test, y_pred)
431                        CUSTOM_METRIC.append(custom_metric)
432
433                    if self.verbose > 0:
434                        scores_verbose = {
435                            "Model": name,
436                            "R-Squared": r_squared,
437                            "Adjusted R-Squared": adj_rsquared,
438                            "RMSE": rmse,
439                            "Time taken": time.time() - start,
440                        }
441
442                        if self.custom_metric:
443                            scores_verbose["Custom metric"] = custom_metric
444
445                        print(scores_verbose)
446                    if self.predictions:
447                        predictions[name] = y_pred
448                except Exception as exception:
449                    if self.ignore_warnings is False:
450                        print(name + " model failed to execute")
451                        print(exception)
452
453        scores = {
454            "Model": names,
455            "Adjusted R-Squared": ADJR2,
456            "R-Squared": R2,
457            "RMSE": RMSE,
458            "Time Taken": TIME,
459        }
460
461        if self.custom_metric:
462            scores["Custom metric"] = CUSTOM_METRIC
463
464        scores = pd.DataFrame(scores)
465        scores = scores.sort_values(by=self.sort_by, ascending=True).set_index(
466            "Model"
467        )
468
469        self.best_model_ = self.models_[scores.index[0]]
470
471        if self.predictions:
472            predictions_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(predictions)
473        return scores, predictions_df if self.predictions is True else scores

def set_config( assume_finite=None, working_memory=None, print_changed_only=None, display=None): 
32def set_config(
33    assume_finite=None,

36    display=None,

38    """Set global mlsauce configuration
39
40    .. versionadded:: 0.3.0
41
42    Parameters
43    ----------
44    assume_finite : bool, optional
45        If True, validation for finiteness will be skipped,
46        saving time, but leading to potential crashes. If
47        False, validation for finiteness will be performed,
48        avoiding error.  Global default: False.
49
50        .. versionadded:: 0.3.0
51
52    working_memory : int, optional
53        If set, mlsauce will attempt to limit the size of temporary arrays
54        to this number of MiB (per job when parallelised), often saving both
55        computation time and memory on expensive operations that can be
56        performed in chunks. Global default: 1024.
57
58        .. versionadded:: 0.3.0
59
60    print_changed_only : bool, optional
61        If True, only the parameters that were set to non-default
62        values will be printed when printing an estimator. For example,
63        ``print(SVC())`` while True will only print 'SVC()' while the default
64        behaviour would be to print 'SVC(C=1.0, cache_size=200, ...)' with
65        all the non-changed parameters.
66
67        .. versionadded:: 0.3.0
68
69    display : {'text', 'diagram'}, optional
70        If 'diagram', estimators will be displayed as text in a jupyter lab
71        of notebook context. If 'text', estimators will be displayed as
72        text. Default is 'text'.
73
74        .. versionadded:: 0.3.0
75
76    See Also
77    --------
78    config_context: Context manager for global mlsauce configuration
79    get_config: Retrieve current values of the global configuration
80    """
81    if assume_finite is not None:
82        _global_config["assume_finite"] = assume_finite
83    if working_memory is not None:
84        _global_config["working_memory"] = working_memory
85    if print_changed_only is not None:
86        _global_config["print_changed_only"] = print_changed_only
87    if display is not None:
88        _global_config["display"] = display

@contextmanager
def config_context(**new_config): 
 91@contextmanager
 92def config_context(**new_config):
 93    """Context manager for global mlsauce configuration
 94
 95    Parameters
 96    ----------
 97    assume_finite : bool, optional
 98        If True, validation for finiteness will be skipped,
 99        saving time, but leading to potential crashes. If
100        False, validation for finiteness will be performed,
101        avoiding error.  Global default: False.
102
103    working_memory : int, optional
104        If set, mlsauce will attempt to limit the size of temporary arrays
105        to this number of MiB (per job when parallelised), often saving both
106        computation time and memory on expensive operations that can be
107        performed in chunks. Global default: 1024.
108
109    print_changed_only : bool, optional
110        If True, only the parameters that were set to non-default
111        values will be printed when printing an estimator. For example,
112        ``print(SVC())`` while True will only print 'SVC()', but would print
113        'SVC(C=1.0, cache_size=200, ...)' with all the non-changed parameters
114        when False. Default is True.
115
116        .. versionadded:: 0.3.0
117
118    display : {'text', 'diagram'}, optional
119        If 'diagram', estimators will be displayed as text in a jupyter lab
120        of notebook context. If 'text', estimators will be displayed as
121        text. Default is 'text'.
122
123        .. versionadded:: 0.3.0
124
125    Notes
126    -----
127    All settings, not just those presently modified, will be returned to
128    their previous values when the context manager is exited. This is not
129    thread-safe.
130
131    Examples
132    --------
133    >>> import mlsauce
134    >>> from mlsauce.utils.validation import assert_all_finite
135    >>> with mlsauce.config_context(assume_finite=True):
136    ...     assert_all_finite([float('nan')])
137    >>> with mlsauce.config_context(assume_finite=True):
138    ...     with mlsauce.config_context(assume_finite=False):
139    ...         assert_all_finite([float('nan')])
140    Traceback (most recent call last):
141    ...
142    ValueError: Input contains NaN, ...
143
144    See Also
145    --------
146    set_config: Set global mlsauce configuration
147    get_config: Retrieve current values of the global configuration
148    """
149    old_config = get_config().copy()
150    set_config(**new_config)
151
152    try:
153        yield
154    finally:
155        set_config(**old_config)

Context manager for global mlsauce configuration

Parameters

assume_finite : bool, optional If True, validation for finiteness will be skipped, saving time, but leading to potential crashes. If False, validation for finiteness will be performed, avoiding error. Global default: False.

working_memory : int, optional If set, mlsauce will attempt to limit the size of temporary arrays to this number of MiB (per job when parallelised), often saving both computation time and memory on expensive operations that can be performed in chunks. Global default: 1024.

print_changed_only : bool, optional If True, only the parameters that were set to non-default values will be printed when printing an estimator. For example, print(SVC()) while True will only print 'SVC()', but would print 'SVC(C=1.0, cache_size=200, ...)' with all the non-changed parameters when False. Default is True.

*New in version 0.3.0.*

display : {'text', 'diagram'}, optional If 'diagram', estimators will be displayed as text in a jupyter lab of notebook context. If 'text', estimators will be displayed as text. Default is 'text'.

*New in version 0.3.0.*

Notes

All settings, not just those presently modified, will be returned to their previous values when the context manager is exited. This is not thread-safe.

Examples

>>> import mlsauce
>>> from mlsauce.utils.validation import assert_all_finite
>>> with config_context(assume_finite=True):
...     assert_all_finite([float('nan')])
>>> with config_context(assume_finite=True):
...     with config_context(assume_finite=False):
...         assert_all_finite([float('nan')])
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
ValueError: Input contains NaN, ...
